docs.lead_paragraph: The family of a man who died from dehydration and malnutrition in a jail in Washington state has filed a claim accusing the guards of negligence.

headline.print_headline: Family of Inmate Who Died of Dehydration, Hunger Files Claim

docs.lead_paragraph: Landing that first job out of college calls for a celebration. But when the party is over, it's time to sit down and figure out how to make your money work for you.

headline.main: Landed Your First Job? Tips for Managing Your Money
headline.print_headline: Landed Your First Job? Tips for Managing Your Money

docs.snippet: Landing that first job out of college calls for a celebration. But when the party is over, it's time to sit down and figure out how to make your money work for you.

headline.main: When Online Loan Applications Lead to Unauthorized Bank Account Debits
headline.print_headline: Two Loan Firms Accused of Fraud in Online Scheme

docs.abstract: Federal regulators charged two data brokers with illegally selling consumers’ loan applications to nonlenders that used the sensitive financial information to commit fraud.
docs.snippet: Federal regulators charged two data brokers with illegally selling consumers’ loan applications to nonlenders that used the sensitive financial information to commit fraud.

docs.lead_paragraph: Instead of an outright repeal, the “Cadillac tax” should be adjusted by Congress to eliminate inequities.

headline.main: Keep the Tax on High-End Health Plans
headline.print_headline: Keep the Tax on High-End Health Plans

docs.abstract: Editorial warns call by legislators and lobbyists to repeal impending tax on so-called Cadillac health plans offered by many employers would undermine survival of Affordable Care Act; argues tax helps to reduce cost of health care coverage by discouraging excessive spending on over-generous health plans; holds Congress should not repeal tax but find smart ways to adjust it to increase coverage overall.
docs.snippet: Instead of an outright repeal, the “Cadillac tax” should be adjusted by Congress to eliminate inequities.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of people without health insurance dropped by 15.8 million, or one-third, since 2013, as major provisions of the Affordable Care Act took effect, the administration said.

headline.main: Number of Uninsured Has Declined by 15 Million Since 2013, Administration Says
headline.print_headline: Number of Uninsured Has Declined by 15 Million Since 2013, Administration Says

docs.abstract: National Center for Health Statistics reports that 29 million people lacked health insurance in first quarter of 2015, down seven million from 2014 average; reports that number of uninsured has fallen by 15.8 million, or one-third, since 2013.
docs.snippet: The number of people without health insurance dropped by 15.8 million, or one-third, since 2013, as major provisions of the Affordable Care Act took effect, the administration said.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge is expected to rule soon on whether the House can sue the executive branch for usurping its authority over spending.

headline.main: House Republicans, Seizing on Health Law, Challenge Executive Branch
headline.print_headline: House Republicans Seize on Health Law to Challenge Executive Power

docs.abstract: House Republicans, long seeking way to challenge Obama administration for flouting congressional authority, settle on healthcare law to challenge executive power; federal judge is expected to rule soon on whether House can sue executive branch for usurping its authority over spending in relation to Affordable Care Act; suit would mark first in which the House has won right to sue executive branch over appropriations power.
docs.snippet: A federal judge is expected to rule soon on whether the House can sue the executive branch for usurping its authority over spending.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mike Lee, the junior senator from Utah who helped lead the government shutdown effort, has a reputation of defying party leaders as well as cooperating with Democrats on libertarian-leaning policy.

headline.main: A Republican Agitator in the Senate Makes Friends Across the Aisle
headline.print_headline: Republican Senator Straddles Fine Line, Shunning Usual Partisan Path

docs.abstract: Profile of Sen Mike Lee of Utah, Tea Party member who has upset Democrats by threatening to help shut down government, but who has nevertheless aligned himself with liberal Democrats over Republicans on issues like privacy and criminal justice reform.
docs.snippet: Mike Lee, the junior senator from Utah who helped lead the government shutdown effort, has a reputation of defying party leaders as well as cooperating with Democrats on libertarian-leaning policy.

docs.lead_paragraph: A top 800-meter runner has refused to sign a document that requires American athletes to wear Nike gear at official team functions at the world championships, which begin Aug. 22 in Beijing.

headline.main: Gear Dispute Costs Nick Symmonds a Trip to Track Worlds
headline.print_headline: Dispute Over Gear Costs U.S. Runner a Trip to the World Championships

docs.abstract: Champion runner Nick Symmonds is cut from United States track team after refusing to agree to wear only gear made by Nike, official sponsor of USA Track & Field, at world championships in Beijing; says he would wear official gear at competitions, news conferences and awards ceremonies, but requirement that he bring no gear other than Nike violates his endorsement contract with Brooks Running.
docs.snippet: A top 800-meter runner has refused to sign a document that requires American athletes to wear Nike gear at official team functions at the world championships, which begin Aug. 22 in Beijing.
